stringParam.name: single_gene_id
stringParam.help: Gene IDs (locus tags) are quite different for each species. We use the gene IDs provided by the sequence generator.

stringParam.name: min_mutual_information_score
stringParam.help: Enter the minimum mutual information score to report similarities. The score range is from 0.472 to 1.67

stringParam.name: min_num_query_matches
stringParam.help: Enter the minimum number of queries you want to match to your genes. If you input 5 genes ids for your query and enter 5 minimum number of queries then the only genes returned would be ones that all 5 queries match

stringParam.name: chip_distance
stringParam.help: Enter the maximum distance you want to allow the center of the peak to be from the 5' end of the gene. Note that the larger the value entered here (3000 bp maximum) the greater the chance for aberrant results.

enumParam.name: chip_antibodies
enumParam.help: Choose the antibody to be considered for this query.

enumParam.name: chip_reps
enumParam.help: Choose the number of replicates for this antibody. Note that the PLK (TypeII) strain was only done with one replicate.

enumParam.name: chip_antibody_count
enumParam.help: Require that all genes returned have peaks generated by both antibodies.

enumParam.name: chip_direction
enumParam.prompt: Peak location relative to 5' end of gene
enumParam.help: Choose whether the peak should be upstream or downstream of the 5' end of the gene.

enumParam.name: chip_strain
enumParam.help: Choose the strain from which the samples were prepared.

stringParam.name: st_max_five_prime_distance
stringParam.help: Enter the maximum distance you want to allow the tag to be from the 5' end of the gene. This is assuming that the gene model does not contain the entire transcribed region which is frequently the case. Note that the larger the value entered here (1000 bp maximum) the greater the chance for aberrant results.

stringParam.name: st_max_three_prime_distance
stringParam.help: Enter the maximum distance you want to allow the tag to be from the 3' end of the gene. This is assuming that the gene model does not contain the entire transcribed region which is frequently the case. Note that the larger the value entered here (1000 bp maximum) the greater the chance for aberrant results.

stringParam.name: st_min_tag_count
stringParam.help: Enter the minimum frequency of the SAGE tags meeting your criteria. Tags must have this minimum frequency in at least one selected SAGE library.

stringParam.name: st_max_occurrences
stringParam.help: Enter the maximum number of times the sequence for this SAGE tag is present in the genome.

flatVocabParam.name: sage_tag_library
flatVocabParam.help: Select the SAGE tag library for this query.

flatVocabParam.name: sage_tag_library_name
flatVocabParam.help: Select the SAGE tag library for this query.

enumParam.name: sense_antisense
enumParam.help: Choose whether to consider SAGE tags which are sense or antisense relative to the genes returned.

enumParam.name: plasmo_new_product
enumParam.help: Choose whether to return genes with new product names.

enumParam.name: plasmo_new_ec
enumParam.help: Choose whether to return genes with EC numbers assigned at workshop

enumParam.name: plasmo_new_go
enumParam.help: Choose whether to return genes with GO terms assigned at the workshop.

enumParam.name: plasmo_new_model
enumParam.help: Choose whether to return genes with altered gene models.

enumParam.name: plasmo_snapshot_changed
enumParam.help: Choose whether to return genes that have been updated since the last re-annotation snapshot was provided in PlasmoDB. The actual annotation may not have changed if a gene has now been reviewd that had not been reviewed previously.

enumParam.name: plasmo_annot_status
enumParam.help: Choose which genes to return based on their re-annotation status.

stringParam.name: sage_tag_min_r
stringParam.help: Choose a minimum R value to be returned. Stekel et al.â€™s R-statistic (Stekel, Git, and Falciani 2000) scores SAGE tags on differential expression among libraries (more variable tags have higher R values), with no assignment of significance values.

stringParam.name: ec_number_pattern
stringParam.help: Enzyme Commission numbers describe enzymes hierarchically by the class of rections they catalize. Use '-' as a wildcard in place of numbers to denote partial EC Numbers.

stringParam.name: num_exons_gte
stringParam.help: Which genes are annotated as containing introns? One easy way to do this search is to look for genes with more than one annotated exon. Enter a minimum of exons you would like to search for as an integer, e.g. '3'.

stringParam.name: num_exons_lte
stringParam.help: Enter a maximum number of exons you would like to search for as an integer, e.g. '3'.

stringParam.name: min_number_est_aligned
stringParam.help: Enter the minimum number of ESTs that must align from the libraries selected to return a gene.

stringParam.name: confidence
stringParam.help: PaGE reports 1 - False Discovery Rate (FDR), which is called the "confidence" for the predictions. The FDR of a set of predictions is the expected percent of false predictions in the set of predictions. For example if the algorithm returns 100 genes with a false discovery rate of .3 (confidence=0.7) then we should expect 70 of them to be correct.

stringParam.name: fold_change
stringParam.help: Enter a non-negative number. NOTE: Fold change is reported in the summary as positive numbers for up-regulated genes and negative numbers for down-regulated genes

stringParam.name: correlation
stringParam.help: Enter a non-negative number. NOTE: Correlation is reported in the summary as positive numbers for positively correlated genes and negative numbers for negatively correlated genes

enumParam.name: regulated_dir
enumParam.help: For ConditionA vs. ConditionB, select up-regulated for genes where ConditionA > ConditionB and select down-regulated for genes where ConditionB > ConditionA.

enumParam.name: correlation_dir
enumParam.help: There are two types or directions of correlation (two patterns that correlations can follow).

stringParam.name: min_tm
stringParam.help: Proteins may have none, one or more transmembrane domains. Please enter a minimum number of predicted transmembrane domains to start your search.

stringParam.name: max_tm
stringParam.help: Proteins may have none, one or more transmembrane domains. Please enter a maximum number of predicted transmembrane domains to start your search.

stringParam.name: min_sigp_sum_score
stringParam.help: SignalP-NN (neural network) provides four scores and a conclusion for each such that the conclusion is 1 if the score meets a certain criteria and 0 otherwise. The SignalP summary conclusion is the sum of the four conclusions generated by SignalP, thus four is the highest score possible. We consider a summary conclusion score of three to be significant

stringParam.name: min_sigp_d_score
stringParam.help: The D-score is the average of the S-mean and Y-max score from SignalP-NN

stringParam.name: min_sigp_signal_probability
stringParam.help: Signal Probability from SignalP-HMM

enumParam.name: any_or_all_sigp
enumParam.prompt: Matches any or all advanced parameters
enumParam.help: Union or intersection of advanced parameters.

stringParam.name: extDbName
stringParam.help: The name of an external database as found in GUS

stringParam.name: extDbRlsVer
stringParam.help: The version of an external database release as found in GUS

enumParam.name: whole_words
enumParam.help: Select whether to reject text matches that start or end in the middle of a word

flatVocabParam.name: geneType
flatVocabParam.help: 'Repeat genes' refers to the most common 59 repeat families identified in the assembly. They constitute ~39 Mb of the genome and can be classified as (1) virus-like, (2) transposon-like, (3) retrotransposon-like, and (4) unclassified (no similarity to known proteins, peptide motifs, or nucleotide sequences). Most are present in hundreds of copies (average ~660) and each family is extraordinarily homogenous, with a ~2.5% average polymorphism.

enumParam.name: includePseudogenes
enumParam.help: Choose whether to include pseudogenes in your query results.

stringParam.name: protein_id
stringParam.help: Only used in a nested record

stringParam.name: plasmodb_4-4_dataset
stringParam.help: PlasmoDB 4.4 dataset

stringParam.name: go_term
stringParam.help: Enter a GO ID (e.g. "GO:0003824") or GO Term (e.g. "catalytic activity"). Asterisks can be used as wildcard characters in a GO Term (e.g. "*kinase*")

stringParam.name: pfam_term
stringParam.help: Enter a Pfam accession number (e.g. \"PF00478\") or definition (\"NPR nonapeptide repeat\") . Asterisks can be used as wildcard characters in a Pfam definition (e.g. \"Ribosomal*\"

enumParam.name: bait_or_prey
enumParam.prompt: Specified protein is bait or prey
enumParam.help: Optionally specifiy whether given protein is bait or prey

stringParam.name: min_observed
stringParam.prompt: Restrict by the minimum number of times this interaction was found
stringParam.help: Restrict by the minimum number of times this interaction was found

stringParam.name: min_searches
stringParam.prompt: Restrict by the minimum number of searches that found this interaction
stringParam.help: Restrict by the minimum number of searches that found this interaction

enumParam.name: BlastDatabaseType
enumParam.help: The type of the target database (eg CDS, Transcripts, Proteins)

enumParam.name: epitope_confidence
enumParam.help: Epitopes are mapped to genes in @PROJECT_ID@ using high quality BLAST similarities (percent identity >= 97%) between the GenBank proteins listed on IEDB and the proteins found in @PROJECT_ID@, and exact string matching. Confidence levels are assigned to each set of epitopes based on the quality of this mapping. A high confidence is assigned to a set where all of the epitopes are found on a given BLAST hit. A medium confidence is assigned to a set where either some, but not all, of the epitopes in a set are found on a given BLAST hit, or where all of the epitopes in a set are found in a given protein, but the protein was not identified as a match by BLAST. A low confidence is assigned to sets where some, but not all, of the epitopes are found in a given protein, but the protein was not identified by BLAST. Choose one or more assigned confidence levels to search for epitopes in.

enumValue.internal: Full Set Not on Blast Hit','Not Full Set On Blast Hit
Not Full Set Not on Blast Hit

stringParam.name: dn_ds_ratio_upper
stringParam.help: Upper Bound on the ratio of non-synonymous to synonymous coding snps

stringParam.name: dn_ds_ratio_lower
stringParam.help: Lower Bound on the ratio of non-synonymous to synonymous coding snps

stringParam.name: min_num_coding_snps
stringParam.help: Lower Bound on the number of coding snps

stringParam.name: occurrences_upper
stringParam.prompt: Number of SNPs of above class <=
stringParam.help: Upper Bound on the number of SNPs of the selected class

stringParam.name: occurrences_lower
stringParam.prompt: Number of SNPs of above class >=
stringParam.help: Lower Bound on the number of SNPs of the selected class

stringParam.name: snp_density
stringParam.help: Find genes containing a density of coding snps > this parameter. Density is expressed in number of snps / KB of coding sequence

enumParam.name: include_reichenowi
enumParam.help: Click yes to include P. reichenowi snps in this query. P.r snps were generated by alignment of P. reichenowi sequence with the P falciparum 3D7 reference sequence. Note, if you want to only query reichenowi, you must click 'None' in the P. falciparum strains select list.

enumParam.name: include_only_queries
enumParam.help: Click yes to to restrict the results returned to only those genes which have been input as query ids. This allows you to determine the relatedness of your query set

enumParam.name: snp_stat
enumParam.help: Choose the class of SNP you want to query on ... choose minumum and maximum numbers below

enumParam.name: snp_order
enumParam.help: Results will be sorted on this column in descending order

enumParam.name: sort_order
enumParam.help: Results will be sorted ascending or descending order

enumParam.name: profileSet
enumParam.help: Results will be sorted ascending or descending order

enumParam.name: waters_profilesets
enumParam.help: Results will be sorted ascending or descending order

enumParam.name: minOrMax
enumParam.help: Results will be sorted ascending or descending order

enumValue.term: Timing of both max and min expression

enumParam.name: maxExprHour
enumParam.help: Results will be sorted ascending or descending order

enumParam.name: maxPlusMinusHours
enumParam.help: Increase the window for examining the maximum expression time by choosing the number of hours to go in each direction (plus / minus)

enumParam.name: minExprHour
enumParam.help: Results will be sorted ascending or descending order

enumParam.name: minPlusMinusHours
enumParam.help: Increase the window for examining the minimum expression time by choosing the number of hours to go in each direction (plus / minus)

enumParam.name: inductionFold
enumParam.help: Expression induction ratio reflects the change between the highest and lowest expression level for each gene over the time course. Results will be sorted ascending or descending order

enumParam.name: expressionPct
enumParam.help: Expression percentile reflects the expression level of one gene compared to other genes from the same array for one time point. Results will be sorted ascending or descending order

enumParam.name: nonnuclearSequence
enumParam.help: Nonnuclear genomic sequence is from P. falciparum and includes the sequence of the mitochondrial and apicoplast genomes. Note the plastid genome is in two pieces (IR-A and IR-B).
Nonnuclear genomic sequence for T. gondii includes the sequence of the apicoplast genome.

Nonnuclear genomic sequence for Plasmodium is from P. falciparum and includes the sequence of the mitochondrial and apicoplast genomes. Note the plastid genome is in two pieces (IR-A and IR-B). For Toxoplasma, the only nonnuclear genome available is that of the apicoplast

stringParam.name: start_location
stringParam.help: Lower bound on nucleotide range to search for gene

stringParam.name: end_location
stringParam.help: Upper bound on nucleotide range to search for gene. Use a number larger than the sequence length to search to the end of the sequence.

stringParam.name: min_expression_percentile
stringParam.help: Lower bound on expression percentile.

stringParam.name: max_expression_percentile
stringParam.help: Upper bound on expression percentile.

stringParam.name: r_min_expression_percentile
stringParam.help: Lower bound on expression percentile.

stringParam.name: r_max_expression_percentile
stringParam.help: Upper bound on expression percentile.

stringParam.name: yt_min_expression_percentile
stringParam.help: Lower bound on expression percentile.

stringParam.name: yt_max_expression_percentile
stringParam.help: Upper bound on expression percentile.

stringParam.name: ys_min_expression_percentile
stringParam.help: Lower bound on expression percentile.

stringParam.name: ys_max_expression_percentile
stringParam.help: Upper bound on expression percentile.

stringParam.name: ms_min_expression_percentile
stringParam.help: Lower bound on expression percentile.

stringParam.name: ms_max_expression_percentile
stringParam.help: Upper bound on expression percentile.

flatVocabParam.name: extraerythrocytic_stages
flatVocabParam.help: Results will be sorted ascending or descending order

flatVocabParam.name: intraerythrocytic_stages
flatVocabParam.help: Results will be sorted ascending or descending order

enumParam.name: synchronization
enumParam.help: Results will be sorted ascending or descending order

enumParam.name: localization
enumParam.help: Results will be sorted ascending or descending order

stringParam.name: ortholog_pattern
stringParam.help: This will be generated by clicking the species tree nodes.

enumParam.name: phyletic_indent_map
enumParam.help: Results will be sorted ascending or descending order

enumParam.name: phyletic_term_map
enumParam.help: Results will be sorted ascending or descending order

enumValue.internal: Francisella tularensis subsp. tularensis SCHU S4
Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhi str. CT18
Treponema pallidum subsp. pallidum str. Nichols
Vibrio cholerae O1 biovar eltor str. N16961

flatVocabParam.name: metabolic_pathway
flatVocabParam.help: Results will be sorted ascending or descending order

stringParam.name: min_isoelectric_point
stringParam.help: Lower bound for the protein isoelectric point

stringParam.name: max_isoelectric_point
stringParam.help: Upper bound for the protein isoelectric point

stringParam.name: min_molecular_weight
stringParam.help: Lower bound for the protein molecular weight

stringParam.name: max_molecular_weight
stringParam.help: Upper bound for the protein molecular weight

stringParam.name: profile_pattern
stringParam.help: Example: '%hsa:N%pfa:Y%'

stringParam.name: included_species
stringParam.help: List of included species (for documentation only)

stringParam.name: excluded_species
stringParam.help: List of excluded species (for documentation only)

stringParam.name: min_exportpred_score
stringParam.help: mininum requirement of score by ExportPred algorithm

enumParam.name: asexual_blood_stages_value
enumParam.help: Select "do not care", "not observed" or "observed" from the drop down menu, to search for peptides in this stage of the P. berghei life cycle.

enumParam.name: gametocytes_value
enumParam.help: Select "do not care", "not observed" or "observed" from the drop down menu, to search for peptides in this stage of the P. berghei life cycle.

enumParam.name: ookinetes_value
enumParam.help: Select "do not care", "not observed" or "observed" from the drop down menu, to search for peptides in this stage of the P. berghei life cycle.

enumParam.name: oocysts_value
enumParam.help: Select "do not care", "not observed" or "observed" from the drop down menu, to search for peptides in this stage of the P. berghei life cycle.

enumParam.name: sporozoites_value
enumParam.help: Select "do not care", "not observed" or "observed" from the drop down menu, to search for peptides in this stage of the P. berghei life cycle.

stringParam.name: min_interaction
stringParam.help: Set a minimum for the likelihood of interaction

enumParam.name: ms_assay
enumParam.help: Select one or more of the assay type options. The assay types here include male-enriched, female-enriched and mixed gametocyte preparations.

enumValue.term: Lowery MassSpec LC-MS/MS Insoluble Excysted Fraction
enumValue.internal: Lowery MassSpec LC-MS/MS Insoluble Excysted Fraction

enumValue.term: Lowery MassSpec LC-MS/MS Insoluble Non-excysted fraction
enumValue.internal: Lowery MassSpec LC-MS/MS Insoluble Non-excysted fraction

enumValue.display: Soluble Excysted and Non-excysted Fraction LC-MS/MS<sup>§</sup> (C.p.)
enumValue.term: Lowery MassSpec LC-MS/MS Soluble Excysted and Non-excysted fractions
enumValue.internal: Lowery MassSpec LC-MS/MS Soluble Excysted and Non-excysted fractions

enumValue.display: 1D Gel germinated deglycosylated oocyst wall preparation 08-14-2006<sup>¥</sup> (C.p.)
enumValue.term: 1D Gel germinated deglycosylated oocyst wall preparation 08-14-2006
enumValue.internal: 1D Gel germinated deglycosylated oocyst wall preparation 08-14-2006

enumParam.name: mass_spec_stage_sample_pf
enumParam.help: Select a lifecycle stage or sample from the list provided.

stringParam.name: genbank_accession
stringParam.help: Enter a GenBank Accession number

stringParam.name: distanceFromTelomere
stringParam.help: Enter an upper bound on the distance.

stringParam.name: percentLowComplexity
stringParam.prompt: Percent of Low Complexity in Protein
stringParam.help: Enter an lower bound on the percent of low complexity.

stringParam.name: max_centromere_distance
stringParam.help: Enter an upper bound on the distance

enumParam.name: start_from
enumParam.help: Select whether to measure the start point from the beginning or end of the sequence

enumParam.name: end_from
enumParam.help: Select whether to measure the end point from the beginning or end of the sequence

enumParam.name: protein_dataset
enumParam.help: Select whether to measure the end point from the beginning or end of the sequence

stringParam.name: pvalue_cutoff
stringParam.prompt: BLAST P-value less than 10 to the
stringParam.help: Only consider BLAST similarities with a P-value less than ten to the given power.

stringParam.name: accession
stringParam.help: Enter a GenBank, RefSeq, or SwissProt accession number

stringParam.name: min_coil
stringParam.help: Choose a lower bound on the coil percentage. Only genes coding for proteins whose secondary structure contains at least this percentage of coil will be returned.

stringParam.name: max_coil
stringParam.help: Choose an upper bound on the coil percentage. Only genes coding for proteins whose secondary structure contains no more than this percentage of coil will be returned.

stringParam.name: min_strand
stringParam.help: Choose a lower bound on the strand percentage. Only genes coding for proteins whose secondary structure contains at least this percentage of strand will be returned.

stringParam.name: max_strand
stringParam.help: Choose an upper bound on the strand percentage. Only genes coding for proteins whose secondary structure contains no more than this percentage of strand will be returned.

stringParam.name: min_helix
stringParam.help: Choose a lower bound on the helix percentage. Only genes coding for proteins whose secondary structure contains at least this percentage of helix will be returned.

stringParam.name: max_helix
stringParam.help: Choose an upper bound on the helix percentage. Only genes coding for proteins whose secondary structure contains no more than this percentage of helix will be returned.

stringParam.name: ProfileGeneId
stringParam.help: The Gene Id

enumParam.name: ProfileDistanceMethod
enumParam.help: The method used to calculate the similarity distance

stringParam.name: ProfileNumToReturn
stringParam.help: The number of genes in the result

enumParam.name: ProfileSearchGoal
enumParam.help: The searching goal of the profile similarity query

enumParam.name: ProfileProfileSet
enumParam.help: Choose the strain of the profile to search against

enumParam.name: ProfileTimeShift
enumParam.help: Whether to allow time shifting or not

enumParam.name: ProfileScaleData
enumParam.help: Whether to scale result data into [0..1] or not

enumParam.name: ProfileMinShift
enumParam.help: The minimum allowed time shift

enumParam.name: ProfileMaxShift
enumParam.help: The maximum allowed time shift

stringParam.name: text_expression
stringParam.help: Enter a regular expression describing the text term(s) to search for. Example: membrane

enumParam.name: text_fields
enumParam.help: Choose which text fields to search.

stringParam.name: max_pvalue
stringParam.prompt: Max p-value exponent (BLAST Hits v. NRDB)
stringParam.help: Only applicable to the 'Similar proteins' field. Use this to filter away BLAST hits that are below a threshold of significance, so you only search the descriptions of significantly similar proteins.

stringParam.name: e_value
stringParam.help: Enter the maximum E value allowed to report domain matches.

flatVocabParam.name: domain_database
flatVocabParam.help: Choose one of the constituent databases of InterPro.

stringParam.name: domain_accession
stringParam.help: Start typing and then choose a domain from the list of domains that come up. As you type the list gets narrowed to match only those entries that match what you have typed.

flatVocabParam.name: day_and_strain
flatVocabParam.help: Choose one or more strain/day combination

enumParam.name: lineages_a
enumParam.help: Numerator in Fold Change Calculation. fold change greater than 0 means the expression is higher in this sample

enumParam.name: lineages_b
enumParam.help: Denominator in Fold Change Calculation. fold chage less than 0 means the expression is higher in this sample

enumParam.name: subType
enumParam.help: Genes with little or no evidence that overlapped (or were subsumed by) larger genes for which there was evidence such as protein similarities, expression evidence from EST alignments, SAGE or proteomics data were marked as deprecated. These genes will likely be removed in a subsequent release of GiardiaDB (and in GenBank) unless additional evidence is provided indicating they should be moved into the real gene category. Please add a user comment to those deprecated genes for which you have experimental evidence indicating that they are real.

sqlQuery.name: GiardiaAnalyses
sqlQuery.sql: select a.analysis_id internal, replace(a.name, 'PaGE Analysis - ', '') as term from rad.ANALYSIS a, rad.PROTOCOL p where p.protocol_id = a.protocol_id and p.name = 'PaGE'

sqlQuery.name: SageTagLibrary
sqlQuery.sql: select ai.analysis_id as internal, CASE WHEN lg.name like '%Giardia intestinalis%' THEN REPLACE(lg.name,'Giardia intestinalis','Giardia lamblia') ELSE lg.name END as term from rad.ANALYSIS a, Rad.ANALYSISINPUT ai, Rad.LOGICALGROUP lg, Rad.PROTOCOL p, Rad.LOGICALGROUPLINK ll where a.analysis_id = ai.analysis_id and a.protocol_id = p.protocol_id and ai.logical_group_id = lg.logical_group_id and lg.logical_group_id = ll.logical_group_id and p.name = 'Normalization of SAGE tag frequencies to a target total intensity' order by ll.row_id

sqlQuery.name: SageTagLibraryName
sqlQuery.sql: select ass.name as term, ass.name as internal from rad.Assay ass, rad.LOGICALGROUPLINK ll, rad.ANALYSISINPUT ai, rad.ANALYSIS a, rad.PROTOCOL p where p.name = 'Normalization of SAGE tag frequencies to a target total intensity' and p.protocol_id = a.protocol_id and a.analysis_id = ai.analysis_id and ai.logical_group_id = ll.logical_group_id and ll.row_id = ass.assay_id order by ass.assay_id

sqlQuery.name: GeneTypes
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(term_name, 'non_protein_coding', 'misc RNA'), '_encoding', ''), '_', ' ') AS term, sequence_ontology_id AS internal FROM sres.SequenceOntology WHERE term_name IN ('protein_coding', 'rRNA_encoding', 'snRNA_encoding', 'tRNA_encoding', 'non_protein_coding')

SELECT REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(term_name, 'non_protein_coding', 'misc RNA'), '_encoding', ''), '_', ' ') AS term, sequence_ontology_id AS internal FROM sres.SequenceOntology WHERE term_name IN ('protein_coding', 'rRNA_encoding', 'snoRNA_encoding', 'tRNA_encoding', 'non_protein_coding')

SELECT REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(term_name, 'non_protein_coding', 'misc RNA'), '_encoding', ''), '_', ' '),'region','gene') AS term, sequence_ontology_id AS internal FROM sres.SequenceOntology WHERE term_name IN ('protein_coding', 'rRNA_encoding', 'snRNA_encoding', 'tRNA_encoding', 'non_protein_coding', 'repeat_region')

sqlQuery.name: ExtraerythrocyticStages
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT name AS term, element_order AS internal FROM apidb.profileElementName WHERE name IN ('Sporozoite', 'Gametocyte') UNION SELECT 'Either' AS term, 0 as internal FROM dual ORDER BY internal

sqlQuery.name: IntraerythrocyticStages
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT name AS term, element_order AS internal FROM apidb.profileElementName WHERE name IN ('Early Ring', 'Late Ring', 'Early Schizogony', 'Late Schizogony', 'Early Trophozoite', 'Late Trophozoite', 'Merozoite') UNION SELECT 'Any' AS term, 0 as internal FROM dual ORDER BY internal

sqlQuery.name: Mr4Reagents
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT term, internal FROM (SELECT reagent_type AS term, reagent_type AS internal, rownum AS ord FROM (SELECT DISTINCT lower(dr.secondary_identifier) AS reagent_type FROM sres.DbRef dr, sres.ExternalDatabaseRelease edr, sres.ExternalDatabase ed WHERE dr.external_database_release_id = edr.external_database_release_id AND edr.external_database_id = ed.external_database_id AND ed.name = 'MR4DBxRefs' ORDER BY lower(dr.secondary_identifier)) UNION SELECT 'any' AS term, 'any' AS internal, 0 AS ord FROM dual) ORDER BY ord

sqlQuery.name: Clades
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT tn.name AS term, taxon_id AS internal FROM sres.taxonname tn WHERE tn.name IN ('Archaea', 'Eukaryota', 'Apicomplexa', 'Chordata', 'Bacteria')

sqlQuery.name: DomainDatabase
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT DISTINCT ed.name AS term, edr.external_database_release_id AS internal FROM sres.DbRef dr, sres.ExternalDatabaseRelease edr, sres.ExternalDatabase ed WHERE dr.external_database_release_id = edr.external_database_release_id AND edr.external_database_id = ed.external_database_id AND dr.db_ref_id IN (SELECT draf.db_ref_id FROM dots.DomainFeature df, dots.DbRefAaFeature draf, core.AlgorithmInvocation ainv, core.AlgorithmImplementation aimp WHERE df.aa_feature_id = draf.aa_feature_id AND df.row_alg_invocation_id = ainv.algorithm_invocation_id AND ainv.algorithm_implementation_id = aimp.algorithm_implementation_id AND aimp.executable = 'ApiCommonData::Load::Plugin::InsertInterproscanResults') UNION SELECT ' Choose one:' AS term, -1 AS internal FROM dual ORDER BY term

sqlQuery.name: DayAndStrain
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT pen.profile_element_name_id AS internal, DECODE(ps.name, 'winzeler_NF54_pct', 'Strain NF54', 'winzeler_3D7_pct', 'Strain 3D7', 'winzeler_3D7_MACpct', 'Strain 3D7 (MACS-purified)', ps.name) || REPLACE(pen.name, 'Day', ' Day ') AS term FROM apidb.profileSet ps, apidb.profileElementName pen WHERE ps.name IN ('winzeler_3D7_MACpct', 'winzeler_3D7_pct','winzeler_NF54_pct') AND ps.profile_set_id = pen.profile_set_id ORDER BY ps.name, pen.element_order

sqlQuery.name: dailyAnalysis
sqlQuery.sql: select a.name as term, a.analysis_id as internal from rad.protocol p, rad.analysis a where p.name = 'Daily Correlations' and p.protocol_id = a.protocol_id order by a.name

sqlQuery.name: kappeAnalysis
sqlQuery.sql: select a.name as term, a.analysis_id as internal from rad.protocol p, rad.analysis a where p.name = 'Fold Change' and p.protocol_id = a.protocol_id order by a.name

sqlQuery.name: cowmanSample
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT distinct lg.name AS term, lg.logical_group_id AS internal FROM STUDY.Study s, RAD.StudyAssay sa, RAD.AssayAnalysis aa, RAD.analysis a, RAD.Protocol p, RAD.AnalysisInput ai, RAD.LogicalGroup lg WHERE s.name in ('Molecular mechanism for switching of P.falciparum invasion pathways into human erythrocytes', 'P.falciparum strain 3D7, SIR2 knockout', 'Invasion by P. falciparum merozoites suggests a hierarchy of molecular interactions') AND p.name = 'R Expression Statistics' AND sa.study_id = s.study_id AND aa.assay_id = sa.assay_id AND a.analysis_id = aa.analysis_id AND a.protocol_id = p.protocol_id AND ai.analysis_id = a.analysis_id AND lg.logical_group_id = ai.logical_group_id

sqlQuery.name: MetabolicPathways
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT DISTINCT dr.primary_identifier AS internal, TRIM(REPLACE(REPLACE(decode(dr.lowercase_secondary_identifier, null, dr.primary_identifier, dr.lowercase_secondary_identifier),'"',''), CHR(191),'')) AS term FROM sres.DbRef dr, sres.ExternalDatabaseRelease edr, sres.ExternalDatabase ed WHERE dr.external_database_release_id = edr.external_database_release_id AND edr.external_database_id = ed.external_database_id AND ed.name = 'Links to Pathway Maps' AND dr.primary_identifier != 'qualityControl' ORDER BY term

SELECT DISTINCT dr.primary_identifier AS internal, decode(dr.lowercase_secondary_identifier, null, dr.primary_identifier, dr.lowercase_secondary_identifier) AS term FROM sres.DbRef dr, sres.ExternalDatabaseRelease edr, sres.ExternalDatabase ed WHERE dr.external_database_release_id = edr.external_database_release_id AND edr.external_database_id = ed.external_database_id AND ed.name = 'Links to Pathway Maps' ORDER BY term
